entries.name: Snitch
entries.desc:
Pesky and vigilant, the Snitch is an unarmed reconnaissance drone, equipped with an advanced scanning technology. They are frequently found patrolling strategic areas or scouting ahead for other enemy units. If it detects any human threat, it calls in reinforcements from orbit.

The purpose of the Snitch seems to be to uphold communication networks and coordinate orbital drops. Shani refers to them as ARC's 'eyes in the sky': calling in reinforcements and maintaining operational awareness.

The ability to call in reinforcements make Snitches a high-risk target for Raiders who want to avoid escalating encounters. However, some Raiders have been known to intentionally aggravate it in a bid to conveniently harvest Wasp and Hornet Drivers.

The Snitch Scanner, the stand-out component inside this drone, has been repurposed by many a Raider. Most notably, it triggers upon being thrown, calling in reinforcements that target any perceived threats in the Scanner's vicinity.

entries.name: Wasp
entries.desc:
The Wasp is a small, thruster-power drone, flying in tidy patrols with other Wasps and the occasional Hornet. When engaged they switch to erratic flight patterns, making them a challenging target. They are equipped with light guns, and seem to actively scan for potential threats, sometimes mistaking humanoid statues for Raiders.

Wasps are often observed patrolling the skies in predictable patterns, seemingly serving as the first line of security for ARC's probing and extraction operations. They scan for any human activity that could interfere with their operations, and seem drawn to areas with regular Raider activity.

The Wasp’s thrusters are exposed and unarmored, giving practiced Raiders a surefire way to send them crashing down.
While the innards of the drone are fairly simple, its central drive and power unit are worth tearing out. Raiders have shot at it for a makeshift explosive, and various tinkerers of Toledo have been known to use it to craft more advanced contraptions.

A Snitch can call in additional Wasps from orbit, posing a surprise threat to inexperienced Raiders - or a treasure trove of Wasp Drivers for those who come prepared.

entries.name: Hornet
entries.desc:
The Hornet is a small flying drone. Equipped with protective armor on its front side. It sports an electric shock-weapon that stuns and damages its targets.

It’s thought to be designed as an enhanced patrol unit, working with Wasps to neutralize immediate and potential threats to probing sites and other machines.

Like the Wasp damaging its thruster inhibits its flying capabilities. However, since the front thrusters are covered in armor, it takes a steady hand and skilled shot to reach them.

The Hornet Driver is a useful part of the drone's internals. It's speculated by Apollo to control the machine's behavior, and produce the electric shocks for its weapons. Throwing a Hornet Driver at a foe causes it to immediately discharge, stunning the target.

entries.name: Pop
entries.desc:
The Pop is a small unarmored rolling machine; often compared to the Fireball. It’s a quick impulsive enemy that often roams in swarms.

The Pop seems to have little regard for its own safety; carrying an explosive charge that “pops” upon impact, scorching any Raider that lets it get too close

entries.name: Fireball
entries.desc:
The Fireball is a fast-moving, ball-shaped ARC machine, usually spotted rolling around indoor areas. It spews fire at any perceived threat in its vicinity, roasting anyone not made out of fire-resistant materials.

With its speed and flame-throwing capabilities, it can cause great trouble for Raiders; in particular when encountered in groups or alongside Ticks.

entries.name: Tick
entries.desc:
The bane of anyone who values their face-adjacent personal space, the Tick is a small, spider-like machine that leaps at Raiders, munching away at whatever exposed skin it can find. It is predominantly found indoors, crawling on walls or ceilings.

The Tick is a relentless, parasitic creature that often attacks in small groups. While individual Ticks can be easily swatted off, hordes of them are another matter entirely.

Lance used to collect destroyed Ticks 'because they are cute', hanging them from rafters and as ornaments in plants. He was talked out of this habit when children refused to enter his clinic.

entries.name: Turret
entries.desc:
The crude, stationary Turret can be found in buildings all over the Rust Belt. The unit is equipped with a sweeping scanner and a gun capable of unleashing barrages of bullets.

It is speculated that Turrets deploy and mount themselves autonomously, though it is unknown to what extent. What is clear though is that they are spread in generous numbers and force Raiders to be constantly on guard.

Although a nuisance, the Turret scanner emits visible light, allowing them to be avoided by attentive Raiders. It is also not particularly hard to destroy if spotted in time.

entries.name: Shredder
entries.desc: When this relentless lump of menace was first encountered at the Stella Montis facility, it left behind a trail of downed Raiders. It was dubbed the 'Shredder' by what few Raiders managed to get back to safety; a name that wasn't so much clever as it was painfully literal.

entries.name: Sentinel
entries.desc: The Sentinel's light plating leaves it relatively exposed, but it can be challenging for Raider to get close enough for a clean shot. Learning how to approach a Sentinel with going down oneself is a risky endeavor.

entries.name: Rocketeer
entries.desc:
Looming grimly in the skies, the Rocketeer is a large, heavily-armored, long range artillery machine. It dominates open spaces with its powerful missile launchers. It can target Raiders from afar, creating hazardous zones that force Raiders to stay on the move or seek cover.

Like the Wasp and the Hornet, it sports thrusters to stay airborne. While these thrusters are technically weak spots, they are large and take a significant amount of firepower to destroy.

Though its devastating blasts have sent many an overly-bold Raider to the clinic, increased firepower and clever tactics have allowed some to take the Rocketeers down.

entries.name: Leaper
entries.desc:
The Leaper is an agile, four-legged brute, often found stomping around open areas. It is equipped with a powerful shockwave pulse that hits anyone nearby, and can leap at Raiders across astonishing distances. Historically, most Raiders have learned to avoid it altogether.

Leapers are commonly found in high-risk areas, guarding valuable objectives or patrolling alongside smaller, quicker enemies, thus creating layered threats that can be hard to deal with.

After years of gathering intel, constructing outposts, and regaining the faintest semblance of unity, the Leaper is no longer considered the invincible foe it once was. Though still a formidable enemy, the Leaper's Pulse Units can now occassionally be spotted decorating Raider Dens as a trophy.

entries.name: Bastion
entries.desc:
Covered in thick plating, the Bastion is a fortress on legs. While it may be slow, it absolutely dominates wherever it patrols with heavy gatling-gun fire; turning anyone who gets in its way into Swiss cheese.

Based on Raider observations of its behavior, the Bastion is believed to be deployed where ARC detects potential resource deposits worth defending at all costs.

It is much easier to try hampering the Bastion's movement by destroying its legs, which may also help in getting clear shots at its unplated back.

entries.name: Bombardier
entries.desc:
The Bombardier is an imposing slugger, seemingly sharing a strong kinship with the Bastion, albeit with a distinct signature mayhem. It will try to flush Raiders out of cover with heavy mortar fire.

Several theories exist as to how and why ARC deploys its Bombardiers, though all agree that it is a lethal piece of machinery that has sent countless Raiders to the infirmary.

entries.name: Spotter
entries.desc:
Despite its size, the Spotter can take considerable punishment. Combined with its unpredictable flight patterns, it's a frustrating opponent to pin down.

Hunting Spotters creates commotion and might draw the attention of opportunistic Raiders looking to eliminate the competition.

entries.name: Queen
entries.desc: One of the largest of the ARC units and by proxy one of the most deadly, the Queen seems to only make an appearance to guard the Harvester, the purpose of which is still unknown.

entries.name: Matriarch
entries.desc:
The Matriarch makes the Queen look friendly by comparison. This colossal terror dominates the battlefield with punishing barrages that impair vision, cripples movement, and tear Raiders apart.

The Matriarch's Reactor is one of the most sought after trophies. Few Raiders have managed to bring one back home.

entries.name: ARC Probe
entries.desc:
Known across The Rust Belt for their ear-piercing signals, the Probes are sent down on a regular basis, collecting samples and data from the soil before returning back to orbit.

While it is unknown which specific resources ARC is probing for, most pray that whatever it is can't be found in The Rust Belt.

entries.name: ARC Courier
entries.desc:
Zipping across the skies at lightning speed, ARC's Couriers are known to transport smalled goods between sites unknown. Occasionally, Couriers may malfunction, crashing into the soil and sending thick plumes of smoke into the skies.

When pried open, Couriers have been found to contain contents ranging from soil samples to what appear to be spare machine parts.

entries.name: ARC Surveyor
entries.desc:
Evasive and mysterious, the ARC Surveyor is known amongst Raiders as a rich source of high-value ARC tech.

Although unarmed, it should be noted that the ARC Surveyor is not without defensive capabilities. If provoked, it may launch as an attack and try to ram whomever is close by.

entries.name: ARC
entries.desc:
For as long as machines have fallen from the sky, those roaming Topside have referred to them by one name, ARC. Named for the arced shapes displayed on radar screens when they come in from orbit, ARC first came to earth at the beginning of The First Wave, marking a sudden and devastating end to the hopeful era of Sunrise.

While Raiders can only speculate as to the exact nature of ARC's operations, they have been widely observed probing the soil in great numbers, before harvesting natural resources with devastating efficiency. When sudden changes in ARC's operations are observed, it is cause for grave concern.

Though efforts were made to contain the news, rumors soon started spreading throughout Speranza.

The same signal was later heard at the Red Tower Hideout in Buried City.

It is generally accepted that ARC's security forces constantly refine their designes and tactics in the face of new threats. This is especially apparent when comparing the rudimentary machines of the First Wave to the more sophisticated designs of the Second.

Raiders are caught in a constant arms race with their orbital foes; seeking to outwit them with advanced weaponry and more refined tactics.

Inventors across Toledo have sought to repurpose ARC's technology as a way to stay ahead, leading to the development of energy=based Shields, and various makeshift gadgets and grenades.
